alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 745 PM MDT/845 PM CDT/... At 716 PM MDT/816 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Wray, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and southwestern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Laird, Beecher Island and Heartstrong. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 231 and 255. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
